meanings.definition: A protein that forms the filament of bacterial flagella.
meanings.sent1: The flagellin helps bacteria move around.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study flagellin to understand how bacteria swim.
meanings.sent3: The flagellin decided to take a break from spinning around.
meanings.sent4: Like a tiny dancer, flagellin twirls the bacteria through the liquid.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, flagellin looks like a long, thin thread waving in the breeze.

meanings.definition: A protein that plays a role in the immune response to bacterial infections.
meanings.sent1: When the body detects flagellin, it knows bacteria are present.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study flagellin to develop better treatments for infections.
meanings.sent3: The immune system high-fived flagellin for alerting it to the bacteria.
meanings.sent4: Flagellin acts as a messenger, calling the immune system to action.
meanings.sent5: In the battle against bacteria, flagellin is the first to sound the alarm.
